intro: Valeriana collina monstr. vesicarium, commonly known as the bladder vetcher, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces distinctive bladder-like seed pods that split open to release seeds. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, it thrives in dry, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
